datafield.subfield: Qāḍī Khān, al-Ḥasan ibn Manṣūr al-Ūzjandī al-Farghānī,
جزء الاول من كتاب قاضي خان
Title from inscription on front flyleaf (p.1):
Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 562 v.1

Origin: As appears in colophon on p.571, copied by Yūsuf ibn Khiḍr [Khaḍir] ibn Muḥammad al-Bāqānī al-Ḥanbalī. Given date of patronage statement and date of transcription given in second volume (Ṣafar 957 [February-March 1550], commissioned and copied by the same patron and copyist), transcription of this volume likely completed in 1550.
Former shelfmark: From interior of upper cover "IL 264" (likely supplied by Yahuda).

Binding: Boards covered in red cloth ; Type II binding (with flap) ; pastedowns and flyleaves in brown wove paper ; now sewn in white thread, two stations ; worked chevron endbands in red and yellow, quite good condition ; overall in fairly good condition with some staining, abrasion, etc.

Support: non-European (likely Arab) laid paper with 9 laid lines per cm. (horizontal) and chain lines (vertical) grouped in threes with 10-14 between chains and 28-34 between groups (see p.62, etc.) ; sturdy and dense, well-burnished to glossy ; minor pest damage.
Decoration: Keywords, section headings, and abbreviation symbols rubricated or in blue ink ; textual dividers in the form of inverted commas in red.

Script: Naskh ; elegant 'Syrian' (Palestinian) hand ; partially but irregularly seriffed with slight effect of tilt to the left, curvilinear descenders (often sweeping), elongation of horizontal strokes, pointing in distinct dots, some free assimilation of letters.
Layout: Written in 29 lines per page ; frame-ruled.
Collation: ii, 28 V(280), i ; exclusively quinions ; foliation in black and red ink, Hindu-Arabic numerals ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals, supplied during digitization (includes flyleaves).

Colophon: "تم الجزء الاول من كتاب قاضي خان على روح مؤلفه الرحمة والرضوان ... على يد العبد الفقير الحقير المعترف بالعجز والتقصير راجي عفو ربه اللطيف الحنين المنان يوسف بن خضر [؟] بن محمد الباقاني نسبا والحنبلي مذهبا غفر الله له ولوالديه ولمن قرأ فيه او نظر فيه ودعا له ولوالديه ولجميع المسلمين بالمغفرة والرحمة ... والحمد لله رب العالمين"
Explicit: "ولو رأى امرأة تزني ثم تزوجها ان حبلت من المزني لا يطأها حتى تضع حملها وان لم تحبل يستحب له ان لا يطأها حتى تحيض والله اعلم بالصواب"

Incipit: "الحمد لله رب العالمين والصلاة على رسوله محمد واله اجمعين حمدا يقربنا الى مرضات الله تعالى وكرامته وصلاة تبلغنا الى محبة الرسول وشفاعته ... قال القاضي الامام ... الحسن بن منصور بن محمود الاوزجندي ... ذكرت في هذا الكتاب من المسائل التي يغلب وقوعها ويمس الحاجة اليها ..."
Juynboll, T. W. "Ḳāḍī Khān, Fakhr al-Dīn al-Ḥasan b. Manṣūr al-Farghānī." In EI2,

First of two volumes constituting a fine copy of Qāḍīkhān's (d.1196) treatise on fiqh, preceded by a table of contents (pp.4-7) ; this volume opening with the preface (followed by Kitāb al-Ṣalāh) and concluding with Bāb al-Istibrāʼ from Kitāb al-Buyūʻ.
Acquired in 1926 from the bookseller Isaac Benjamin S.E. Yahuda via purchase transacted on his behalf by Abraham Shalom Yahuda (1877-1951), his younger brother.

Ownership / patronage statement on p.5 dated 957 [1550] in name of Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad, indicating that he had the text copied for him ("بالاستكتاب"), likely in Ramlah, statement reads "دخل في نوبة الفقير محمد ابن احمد عفي عنه بالاستكتاب في مدينة رملة [؟] في سنة ۹٥٧" and is accompanied by two scalloped, almond-shaped seal impressions (also appearing on p.7), compare statement in second volume [Isl. Ms. 562 v.2] ; collation statement on p.5 "وعدد كراريسه مع البياض ٢٨" ; ownership statement on p.7 in name of al-Sayyid al-Ḥājj Ḥasan [Ḥusayn?] Rushdī ibn al-Ḥājj Muḥammad Surūrī (Hacı Hasen [Hüseyin ?] Rüştü bin Hacı Mehmet Sürurî), reads "تملكه الفقير اليه عز شأنه السيد الحاج حسن [حسين ؟] رشدى بن الحاج محمد سرورى عفى عنهما" ; occasional marginal corrections, glosses and notabilia (side-heads).
Yūsuf ibn Khiḍr ibn Muḥammad al-Bāqānī al-Ḥanbalī,
يوسف بن خضر بن محمد الباقاني الحنبلي,
قاضي خان، الحسن بن منصور الاوزجندي الفرغاني.
